intro: Stenodraba glareosa, commonly known as the shining sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Stenodraba glareosa is often found growing on rocky soils and in sandy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions.
